intro: Eucalyptus bridgesiana var. amblycorys, commonly known as the narrow-leaf mallees, is a shrub or small tree native to Western Australia. It is characterized by its narrow, leathery leaves that are typically grey-green in color. The flowers are usually small and white or pink, appearing in clusters during the winter and spring. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or gravelly soils. This variety is notable for its resilience and is sometimes used in ecological restoration projects.
